abstract: Both sides are closely watching consequences of US Court of Appeals for Ninth Circuit decision, which ruled that insurers in California must pay for residential treatment for eating disorders and other mental illnesses under state's mental parity law; laws, also enacted in other states, generally require that coverage for mental disorders be equivalent to that for physical ailments, but parity can be difficult to define; Blue Shield of California, defendant in lawsuit, is seeking to have case reheard
snippet: People with eating disorders like anorexia are fighting insurers to pay for stays in residential treatment centers, an issue that is being considered by an appeals court in California.
lead_paragraph: People with eating disorders like anorexia are fighting insurers to pay for stays in residential treatment centers, an issue that is being considered by an appeals court in California.

headline.main: Eating Disorders a New Front in Insurance Fight
headline.print_headline: Eating Disorders a New Front in Insurance Fight
headline.seo: Ruling Offers Hope to Eating Disorder Sufferers
